author: Joshua Franklin
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Uber Technologies Inc’s drivers in New York will go on strike next week shortly before the ride-hailing company goes public to protest what they view as unfair employment conditions, a taxi union said on Friday.
title: Ride-hailing drivers in New York to strike ahead of Uber IPO

author: Mark Hosenball
summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The former head of White House security clearances told congressional investigators on Wednesday he was never instructed to change a security clearance determination by anyone at the White House, a source familiar with his closed-door interview said.
title: Official says White House never told him to change a security clearance decision -source

author: Munsif Vengattil,Paresh Dave
summary: HYDERABAD, India/SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - Facebook Inc has thousands of content labelers around the world who categorize content with the aim of creating large datasets that can be more readily analyzed by humans and software.
title: Factbox: The work at one Facebook 'labeling' project

summary: (Reuters) - Facebook Inc and the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) are negotiating a possible settlement that would require the company to create an independent privacy oversight committee and take other steps to safeguard users, Politico reported on Wednesday, citing a source.
title: Facebook settlement with U.S. may include privacy oversight: Politico

summary: BERLIN (Reuters) - German carmaker Volkswagen will join forces with China’s NIU to produce battery-powered kick scooters, German newspaper Die Welt reported on Monday without giving sources.
title: Volkswagen teams up with China's NIU to make e-scooters: Die Welt

author: Munsif Vengattil,Paresh Dave
summary: HYDERABAD, India/SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - Over the past year, a team of as many as 260 contract workers in Hyderabad, India has ploughed through millions of Facebook Inc photos, status updates and other content posted since 2014.

author: Julie  Zhu,Kane Wu
summary: HONG KONG (Reuters) - Sequoia Capital China, widely viewed as a bellwether for Chinese tech investment, is set to lay off as much as 20 percent of its investment staff as a slowdown in the country’s tech sector saps appetite for risk, said two people with knowledge of the matter.

summary: (Reuters) - Alphabet Inc’s Google is set to roll out a dashboard-like function in its Chrome browser to offer users more control in fending off tracking cookies, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.
title: Google set to launch privacy tools to limit online tracking: WSJ

author: Angela Moon,Paresh Dave
summary: NEW YORK/MOUNTAIN VIEW, California (Reuters) - Alphabet Inc’s Google launched more affordable versions of its Pixel smartphone on Tuesday at about half the price of its current models, and dropped an exclusive U.S. distribution deal with Verizon Communications Inc, signaling a major shift in the tech giant’s hardware strategy.

author: Jan  Wolfe
summary: (Reuters) - Like numerous U.S. presidents before him, Donald Trump could cite the legal doctrine of “executive privilege” to try to block congressional investigators from getting access to certain documents and witnesses they are seeking.

summary: HONG KONG (Reuters) - Hackers stole bitcoin worth $41 million from Binance, one of the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchanges, the company said on Wednesday, the latest in a string of thefts from cryptocurrency exchanges around the world.
title: Hackers steal $41 million worth of bitcoin from Binance cryptocurrency exchange

summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - Lyft Inc’s stock slumped nearly 11% on Wednesday to a record low after the ride-hailing company posted a deep quarterly loss, putting pressure on Uber Technologies Inc as it prepares to price its initial public offering.

author: Paresh Dave
summary: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif. (Reuters) - Alphabet Inc’s Google business on Tuesday announced new privacy controls for its services, including “Incognito mode” for Google Maps, and published new privacy commitments for its hardware, showing how increased public scrutiny is forcing greater transparency in Silicon Valley.

author: Stephen Nellis

summary: TOKYO (Reuters) - Japan’s Toyota Motor Corp and Panasonic Corp said they plan to establish a joint company to develop “connected” services to be used in homes and urban development.

author: David Morgan

summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A U.S. senator plans to introduce legislation on Thursday to streamline regulation and permitting requirements for the development of mines for lithium, graphite and other electric-vehicle supply chain minerals, part of a plan to offset China’s dominance in the space.

(Reuters) - Alphabet Inc unit Google in the coming months plans to introduce new internet browser tools to limit how users’ web activity is tracked by advertising companies and give them greater insight into why certain ads are shown to them, the company announced in blog posts on Tuesday.

Jan Kees de Jager said on a conference call that normally dropping a key vendor would lead to greater procurement costs, but that was not true in this case.

author: Tom Wilson,Tommy Wilkes
summary: LONDON (Reuters) - Bitcoin soared to its highest in almost five months on Tuesday, pulling smaller cryptocurrencies up with it, after a major order by an anonymous buyer set off a frenzy of computer-driven trading, analysts said.
title: Bitcoin jumps 20 percent, mystery order seen as catalyst

author: Fathin Ungku
summary: SINGAPORE (Reuters) - Singapore submitted wide-ranging fake news legislation in parliament on Monday, stoking fears from internet firms and human rights groups that it may give the government too much power and hinder freedom of speech.
title: Facebook, rights groups hit out at Singapore's fake news bill

author: Josephine Mason
summary: LONDON (Reuters) - Atos said on Tuesday it has alerted the French markets regulator after Berenberg withdrew its downgrade of the software company’s stock, which briefly wiped almost 450 million euros  ($503.42 million) off its market capitalization.
title: As stock sinks after Berenberg error, Atos alerts French markets watchdog

summary: STUTTGART (Reuters) - Daimler Chief Executive Dieter Zetsche said on Tuesday the debate surrounding the safety of Boeing’s aircraft shows how hard it can be to win public acceptance for autonomous car technology.
title: Daimler CEO: Boeing safety debate highlights challenge for autonomous tech

summary: (Reuters) - Here is a timeline of significant developments in Special Counsel Robert Mueller’s investigation into Russia’s role in the 2016 U.S. presidential election and whether President Donald Trump’s campaign conspired with Moscow.
title: Timeline: Big moments in Mueller investigation of Russian meddling in 2016 U.S. election

summary: WARSAW (Reuters) - Poland will require Uber to use licensed taxi drivers from next year, under a plan approved by the cabinet on Tuesday aimed at creating fair competition.
title: Poland plans stricter rules for transport companies like Uber

summary: (This April 1 story corrects the full name of OLED in paragraph 2)
title: Troubled Apple supplier Japan Display to seek funding, shares surge

summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The chairman of the U.S. House of Representatives Judiciary Committee, Jerry Nadler, said on Sunday his panel would call Attorney General William Barr to testify shortly, citing concerns over Barr’s conclusions from Special Counsel Robert Mueller’s Russia probe report.
title: Democratic panel chair to call AG Barr to testify on Mueller report

summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - White House spokeswoman Sarah Sanders said on Sunday the Department of Justice’s findings on the probe into Russian interference in the 2016 election were a “total and complete exoneration of the President of the United States.”
title: White House spokeswoman says DOJ findings a 'total exoneration' of Trump

author: Sai Sachin Ravikumar
summary: MUMBAI (Reuters) - WhatsApp on Tuesday launched a service for Indians to check the veracity of information, in the messaging platform’s latest attempt to combat fake news in India ahead of national elections beginning this month.
title: WhatsApp launches fact-check service to fight fake news during India polls

summary: TEL AVIV (Reuters) - Intel’s venture capital fund said on Tuesday it invested $120 million in Israel in 2018 and plans to continue to invest in the country in the coming years.
title: Intel Capital invested $120 million in 2018 in Israeli startups

summary: BERLIN (Reuters) - Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Tuesday that Germany needed to make radical changes in the vehicle sector by switching to electric or hydrogen-powered fuel-cell cars.
title: Merkel: We need to switch to electric or hydrogen-powered fuel-cell cars

author: Sankalp Phartiyal,Aditya Kalra
summary: MUMBAI/NEW DELHI (Reuters) - Two weeks after a suicide bombing in Kashmir in February killed 40 Indian paramilitary policemen, a Facebook user called Avi Dandiya posted a live video in which he played a recording of a call purportedly involving India’s home minister, the president of the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and an unidentified woman.
title: Despite being exposed, fake news thrives on social media ahead of India polls

summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Tesla Inc will pay a $31,000 penalty and purchase $55,000 in emergency response equipment for a California city under a settlement reached with the Environmental Protection Agency over federal hazardous waste violations at its automotive factory, the government said Monday.
title: Tesla will pay $31,000 to settle U.S. EPA hazardous waste claims

summary: ZURICH (Reuters) - A Swiss court has backed Swatch Group in a trademark row with Apple Inc over the watchmaker’s use of the “Tick different” slogan, which Apple had decried as an infringement of its “Think Different” advertising campaign.
title: Swiss court backs Swatch in 'Think Different' row with Apple

summary: BEIJING (Reuters) - China’s regulators approved 30 imported online video games Tuesday, including Tencent’s “Game of Thrones: Winter is Coming”, according to a notice on the regulator’s website.
title: China regulator approves 30 imported online video games, including Tencent's

author: Nadine Schimroszik
summary: HANOVER, Germany (Reuters) - Deutsche Telekom’s IT services arm T-Systems is on track to boost core profits this year, the unit’s CEO Adel Al-Saleh told Reuters, but still has its work cut out to start delivering a cash return to Europe’s largest telecoms group.
title: Deutsche Telekom's T-Systems to boost core profits, strives for cash

summary: FRANKFURT (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp and BMW Group on Tuesday launched an initiative to create an Open Manufacturing Platform that seeks to stimulate innovation and accelerate the development of ‘smart’ factories.
title: Microsoft, BMW launch industrial cloud technology partnership

author: Stephen Nellis
summary: (Reuters) - Qualcomm Inc’s chief financial officer, George Davis, has left the company to become finance chief at rival Intel Corp, the two companies said on Tuesday.
title: Qualcomm finance chief departs for rival Intel

author: Didi Akinyelure
summary: LAGOS (Reuters) - Nigerians searching for their dream home to buy or rent are turning to the internet in droves, leading to a surge in the number of property-focused technology firms.
title: Nigeria's 'proptech' boom driven by rising mobile phone use

author: Noel Randewich
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - Lyft Inc’s stock sank further below its IPO price on Tuesday after receiving its first negative review from an analyst who is skeptical that consumers will give up car ownership in favor of relying on ride-hailing services.
title: Lyft falls further from IPO after receiving first 'sell' rating

author: Julia Fioretti
summary: HONG KONG (Reuters) - China’s Tencent Holdings Ltd is returning to the market with a U.S. dollar bond that could raise about $5 billion, two people with direct knowledge of the matter said.
title: Chinese tech giant Tencent plans $5 billion bond sale: sources

author: Julia Fioretti
summary: HONG KONG (Reuters) - Chinese video platform Bilibili’s convertible bond sale and follow-on share offering raised $824 million, four people with direct knowledge of the matter said on Wednesday.
title: Bilibili offering raises $824 million as China techs tap market after IPOs

author: Naomi Tajitsu
summary: TOKYO (Reuters) - Japan’s Toyota Motor Corp will offer free access to its hybrid-vehicle patents through 2030, it said on Wednesday, seeking to expand use of the lower-emission technology even as the global industry shifts toward fully electric cars.
title: Toyota to give royalty-free access to hybrid-vehicle patents

author: Stephen Nellis
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - A trade group for the semiconductor industry on Wednesday called on U.S. government leaders to boost funding for chip research and science education while easing limits on green cards in an effort to counter China’s investments in chip technology.
title: Semiconductor group urges more research funding to counter China

author: David Shepardson
summary: (Reuters) - Three major automakers said on Wednesday they were forming a consortium to help draw up safety standards for self-driving cars that could eventually help create regulations in the United States.
title: GM, Ford and Toyota join to advance self-driving testing, standards

summary: FRANKFURT (Reuters) - Bidding slowed on Wednesday in Germany’s 5G mobile spectrum auction, and with offers from the four companies taking part totaling just 2.4 billion euros ($2.7 billion) it could end up being the cheapest ever.
title: Bidding slows in German 5G auction, could be the cheapest ever

author: Makiko Yamazaki,Yoshiyasu Shida
summary: TOKYO (Reuters) - Japan Display Inc will begin to supply organic light-emitting diode (OLED) screens for the Apple Watch later this year, two sources said, a breakthrough for the cash-strapped company whose late shift to OLED has cost it orders from Apple.
title: Exclusive: Japan Display to supply OLED screens for Apple Watch - sources

author: Tom Hals
summary: WILMINGTON, Del. (Reuters) - Travis Kalanick, the co-founder of ride-hailing company Uber, and the company’s directors won the dismissal of an investor lawsuit that sought to hold them liable for a fight over trade secrets that slowed Uber’s push into autonomous vehicles.
title: Uber's Kalanick, directors win dismissal of investor lawsuit
